title: Brexit: Deutsche Bank cuts probability of no-deal to 35% vs 50%
text:
Brexit: Deutsche Bank cuts probability of no-deal to 35% vs 50%

Forex 2 hours ago (Sep 16, 2019 11:01)

LONDON (Reuters) - Deutsche Bank (DE: ) said on Monday it cut its probability that Britain will crash out of the European Union on Oct. 31 without a deal to 35% from 50% previously after lawmakers passed a law that could force Prime Minister Boris Johnson to delay the process. "Elections remain our base case, however. For now, all eyes will be on both the upcoming Party conferences and any possible breakthrough in the run-up to next month's EU summit," it said in a note. Johnson has pledged to leave the EU with or without a deal on Oct. 31, even though British lawmakers have passed a law which would force him to request a delay beyond that date if he is unable to reach a deal with the EU.

Brexit: Deutsche Bank cuts probability of no-deal to 35% vs 50%
description: Brexit: Deutsche Bank cuts probability of no-deal to 35% vs 50%
